text.__SUMMARY__: Conus kersteni is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Conidae, the cone snails and their allies.Like all species within the genus Conus, these snails are predatory and venomous. They are capable of "stinging" humans, therefore live ones should be handled carefully or not at all.
text.Description: The size of the shell varies between 18 mm and 25 mm.
text.Distribution: This species occurs in the Atlantic Ocean off the island of São Nicolau, Cape Verde.
text.References:
Tenorio & Afonso & Rolàn,  New endemic species of Conus (Gastropoda, Conidae) from the Islands of São Nicolau, Santo Antão and Sal in the Cape Verde Archipelago
